intro: Mesembryanthemum hollandii, commonly known as the Dutch ice plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in winter and produces small, pale yellow to white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Mesembryanthemum hollandii is also known for its ability to tolerate drought and poor soil conditions.
